page.title: 16LANGUAGE:2, PADIHAM LANCS
page.content: Nah, 'ere's a receipt as ah larned fro' me dad - they med it i'Padiham when 'e were a lad. Ah'm sure as yo'll like id - yo cannot but try - so 'ere's 'ow you mek it - Meyl-Crust Appa' Pie. Tek some cookin' appas's, a pahnd iv you wish, an' slice 'em up thin in a strong oven dish: Then mek a nice crust wi' a bit o' good lard, jus' usin' yer fingers so's nod mek it 'ard. Bud use fine oat-meyl as yo'd buy in a bag, wi' a 'andful o' flahr jus' to 'elp it to clag. Then sprinkle brahn sugar all o'er t' top o't fruit an' i' t' middle a spoonful o' butter to boot! Then clap on yer crust wi' th' edges pressed dahn, an' bake id in t' th' oven - a nice gowden brahn. It's an owd country dish as is grand if you please, wi' a shive off a gradely good Lancashire cheese.
